attachments.title: Lumos - A Next Generation Bicycle Helmet
attachments.text: The ultimate bicycle helmet with brake lights and turn signals to help cyclists stay safe and visible on the road.
attachments.fallback: Kickstarter: Lumos - A Next Generation Bicycle Helmet

text: Wish it were that easy and the helmet were the solution.
great idea, but arises from a symptom of the main problem, which is lack of standards on the roadway. What would happen if a car manufacturer put their brake lights in a completely different place?
I love all the attention that bike tech is getting, but nobody's deciding and implementing a safe, legal and unified standard
yeah, the video examples are disorienting. the turn signal doesnt really register
as a car driver behind one of these, i would also be confused about the blinking "brake" light transitioning into a solid
and as a bike driver I want to dispel the notion that simply because of the physics of my vehicle, I need to have my "hazards" on at all times
proper illumination: great. adding new forms of signaling to a vehicle: probably more harmful than good.
